item.title: Basic Authentication in Go with Gin
item.description: This short post looks at adding basic authentication to GoLang applications. Below example application uses the gin web framework. Let’s start by creating a gin router with default middleware. By default, it serves on :8080 unless we define a PORT environment variable. func main(){ r := gin.Default() r.GET("/getAllUsers", basicAuth, handlers.UsersList) _ = r.Run() } Now that we have our primary route let us create a method to add authentication logic. First, get basic auth credentials from the context request and validate them.
